intro: Vitex bulusanensis, commonly known as the Bulusan vitex, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
